resources.string:
Apply: applies the current configuration and exits.
Default: sets the configuration present on first launch
Manual Refresh: sets the configuration to what the device is currently displaying

Note: The Galaxy S8 default resolution is actually 1080x2220 so replace 1920 with 2220. You can manually reset the resolution by going to Settings -> Display -> Resolution and changing it to a new resolution. Then, go to Developer Settings -> Minimum Width and set it to 360 for an S8.

If you are unable to return to a functional resolution, please run these ADB commands and reboot:

adb shell settings put global display_size_forced 1080,1920
adb shell settings put global display_density_forced 480

adb shell wm size reset
adb shell wm density reset
